page.title: 20Totternhoe School
page.content: The present school was built in 1952 and replaced the original 1867 or 1872 building. At present there are 52 children on roll. There are two full-time members of staff, Mr. H. Garrod, the Head, and Mrs. P. Budgell. The part-time teachers are Mrs. J. Wood and Mrs. M. Lawson who comes on Wednesday afternoons to teach Music. The school is divided into two classes. There are five classrooms. One is used by Mrs. D. Bell, the General Assistant. Another is used by the Playgroup. The Secretary is Mrs. J. Lay. School meals are delivered from Lark Rise School. Most children bring sandwiches. The Governors meet once a term. There is an active Parents' Association which raises money and forges links between school and home.
